boardgame.name: North Sea Epilogues GM Screen
boardgame.description: The Mico has illustrated an absolutely gorgeous piece of art for this optional GM Screen. Inside you will find all the necessary rules for running a session, which means less time stuck in the rulebook and more time forging your epic saga! The screen measures 210x1188mm and is mounted onto 1mm high-density cardboard. Once folded, it will be the same dimensions as the book, making it easy to store them together.

boardgame.name: Joan of Arc Role Playing Game Dice Set
boardgame.description: Set of Joan of Arc polyhedral dice (1D4, 1D6, 1D8, 1D10, 1D12, 1D20, 1D100), for all who love special dice.

boardgame.name: アルバ・シビタスのあるきかた (Alba Civitas no Arukikata)
boardgame.description:
アルバ・シビタスのあるきかた (Aruba Shibitasu no Arukikata) (How to walk Alba Civitas) is a game from Japan. Players are travelling around the city of Aruba at night, seeking hidden treasures. They meet local residents, find tools and clues that help them unearth the treasures.

A mixture of memo and actions, the city is a layout of face-down cards. On their turn, a player may move around and flip two cards, and memorise them. The cards have various conditions, and if a player satisfies the conditions, they get to keep the card or cards. These then help them further in their quest. By memorising the locations as all players reveal them, players race to complete the tasks and catch the most treasure to win.
user summary

boardgame.name: Mountain, River, River, Sun
boardgame.description: An extremely simple game, with extremely simple rules, that will nonetheless test your powers of observation, planning, and focus. Try to match the sequence on the goal card with the larger symbols on your cards, while simultaneously preventing your opponent from doing it first with theirs. Trickier than it sounds.

boardgame.name: The One That Got Away
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

SHOTGLASS ROUNDS are 12-page, PDF-only One-Shots for 5e for the DM who doesn’t like to prep! Flexible, convenient, super-charged excitement in a compact package that won’t have you sitting up for hours doing prep for your next game session!

Each adventure is presented in the proven Shotglass Adventures format, designed for a 4-5 hour game. Each PDF includes a two-page spread of the adventure with DM’s map and key (so you can lay it out on the table in front of you and have everything at a glance), 2 new monsters & 2 new magic items, a full-size player’s map with grid & a full-size grid-less player’s map!

boardgame.name: Dungeons Your Party Will Die For
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

DUNGEONS YOUR PARTY WILL DIE FOR is the sequel to Maps Your Party Will Die For!

Published under the OGL and compatible with 5e and OSR fantasy role playing games, DUNGEONS YOUR PARTY WILL DIE FOR is designed especially for all of us in lockdown! I get how difficult it can be to afford new RPG content, so this 36 page book is packed full of fantastic content at a low price to save you money. Inside you’ll find:

10 ‘adventure-on-a-page’ one-shot adventures of all varieties, complete with full color maps! Varied adventures ranging from 1st - 9th level, designed for minimal preparation and flexible delivery. Each adventure can be run as a one-shot or as a side-quest, easily slotted into any campaign.
Hand-drawn, full-color maps - old school style with new school flair!
The rural region of Nothl’nd Central District – containing the vast lakes and Wind’n Plains of Verona Province from Shotglass Adventures! Each adventure is tied to towns and villages throughout the area, and can be used in conjunction with any Shotglass Adventures campaign, or they can be run separately without the need for the setting. These adventures can easily be dropped into any campaign or run as a one-shot.
Guide for OSR conversions!
Bonus extended narrative introductions for each adventure!
Bonus unkeyed maps!

boardgame.name: Maps Your Party Will Die For
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Laidback DM's Maps Your Party Will Die For is a collection of 24 hand-drawn, gridded, full-color maps with Adventure Seeds, complete with a section on designing your own dungeons.

When I’m DM’ing (or GM’ing - let’s be fair, it’s not all about the world’s most popular tabletop role playing game all the time, is it?) I like to have a few maps on hand for when the players go off course, or just in case I haven’t been able to prepare an adventure for a session.

With that in mind, here’s a bunch of full color maps and Adventure Seeds, so that you can whip together an improvised play session on the spot, or prepare one before your game. Each map has a page for ‘‘GM notes’’, for use before or during play - it’s your book, why not write in it?

These maps are system-neutral and can be used with any fantasy game.

boardgame.name: The Watcher's Keep
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Add a little flavor of mystery and intrigue to your BattleSauce Meals (remember? That’s what we call Adventures!) with the The Watcher’s Keep Ingredient. Ingredients are stand-alone gaming elements which can be used to enhance your games - battlemaps, NPCs, mercenaries, weapons, or a little backstory on the realms.

The Watchers are a fanatical sect just getting a foothold in the Southern Hemisphere. As their numbers grow, they spread across the land occupying abandoned structures - using them to watch everywhere and especially the cosmos for signs of things to come and take action when they deem it necessary.

boardgame.name: Operation Mnemosyne
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The operatives go on a dangerous mission in Iceland to infiltrate a data center belonging to the Olympians, and to recover vital information. They will have to deal with heavy security composed of ARES contractors and deadly chimera soldiers. But inside, the operatives will make a sinister discovery, forcing them to make a difficult choice.

Note: An older version of this adventure is already featured in The Savage Sign 01. This new version has been edited (correcting typos) and includes a map.

boardgame.name: Aquilae: Bestiary of the Realm: Volume 2 (DCC)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Aquilae: Bestiary of the Realm is the largest, most comprehensive, most flexible, and most ambitious fantasy roleplaying bestiary ever conceived. 6,400 complete statblocks, comprising 1,600 monsters, each fdsfddsfdsgiven the Quadded Statblock treatment, enabling them to be used in any campaign setting, with PCs of any level.

After enormous initial success with editions for Pathfinder First Edition, Pathfinder Second Edition, and 5E/Fifth Edition, IGS is producing the Bestiary for Dungeon Crawl Classics (DCC).
boardgame.rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game

boardgame.name: Aquilae: Bestiary of the Realm: Volume 2 (OSR)
boardgame.description:
rom publisher blurb:

Short & Sweet: This book is Volume 2 of a 2-volume set that brings together every monster published for Pathfinder, painstakingly and rigorously converted to OSR format. It also adapts each and every monster so that it can be used with adventuring parties of ANY level. 830 monsters, 3,320 complete statblocks, ready to use in ANY OSR adventuring campaign.
boardgame.rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game

boardgame.name: Inn Keeper
boardgame.description:
Compete as Inn Keepers working to fill your Inn with the most guests by winning tricks and placing cards in sequential order on to your board. Earn extra points by offering amenities customers want. Split points for referring guests when you don’t have what they want and for fulfilling your bonus card goals. The Inn Keeper with the most points at the end is the winner!

-description from designer

boardgame.name: The Pursuit of Happiness: Big Box
boardgame.description:
The Pursuit of Happiness: Big Box is a storage option for all The Pursuit of Happiness material released to date. Inside The Pursuit of Happiness: Big Box you can easily fit all material of The Pursuit of Happiness core game, The Pursuit of Happiness: Community expansion, The Pursuit of Happiness: Experiences expansion, The Pursuit of Happiness: Nostalgia expansion and all mini expansions including KS1, KS2, KS3 and KS4 Promo Packs, Thug Life, Out of this World and more. The Big Box also fits all standard or deluxe components of the game.The Pursuit of Happiness: Big Box includes a 2-level plastic custom tray and a consolidated rulebook for all The Pursuit of Happiness material.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: The Pursuit of Happiness: Experiences – Maui
The Pursuit of Happiness: KS Promos 4
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Versions & Editions: Big Box Versions of Individual Games
boardgame.boardgamecompilation: The Pursuit of Happiness: Community KS Promos 2
The Pursuit of Happiness: Experiences KS Promos 3
The Pursuit of Happiness: KS Promos

boardgame.name: NATO, Nukes & Nazis: The Lutwaffe Strikes!
boardgame.description:
"NATO, Nukes & Nazis: The Lutwaffe Strikes!", published by XTR inside the issue #10 of his "Command" wargaming magazine, is an expansion for the alternative-history simulation wargame "NATO, Nukes & Nazis".

In this variant the German economy of the "NNN" world did better during the 1980's than what was first postulated in the original wargame: this resulted in greatly increased production of tactical aircraft types, which in turn will dramatically increase the German offensive potential making it, in some ways, similar to that employed in the 1940 BlitzKrieg against Holland, Belgium and France.

13 new Nazis' counters:
- 9 Tac Air
- 4 Helicopters

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Snollebollekes: Het kaartspel
boardgame.description:
The crazy card game to give every party an extra boost! To the left?! Or to the right ?! You can go in any direction in this card game! Roll the die and strategically discard your cards to earn as many ties as possible. Or don't those ties excite you and would you rather see your friends doing crazy dances, riding on each other's backs and walking the polonaise? Create your own game by adding the party cards and take on crazy physical challenges. Or do you really want to remove all limits and do you want to "drink, lick and dance"? Then add the 18+ cards! Snollebollekes - The card game is for all people who love a damn good party!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Forking Paths (Issue #1)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Forking Paths is my ongoing RPG zine spanning a variety of content. In this inaugural issue, a Guidebook to the Viridian Maw!

This 24-page PDF of the digest-sized zine contains fodder for a wilderness sandbox campaign in the Viridian Maw: an overgrown meteor crater, mutated and reshaped by fungal influence. To get a sense of it, check out the free download below for the one-page version of the setting.

Everything is system neutral & stats agnostic, though the material is written with genre assumptions leaning toward D&D/OSR games (but usable for games like Apocalypse World or Dungeon World, too).

26 wildlife entries including plants, animals, fungi & trees
14 interior illustrations
Overview of peoples living in the crater
Backstory for the ancient history of the Viridian Maw
Advice and tips on using the material


Random tables to generate interesting ruins & encounters
Hexmap with 12 keyed locations

boardgame.name: Forking Paths (Issue #2)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This, the second issue: Lost in Dark Halls. The core of this 24-page digest-sized zine is Labyrinthine, a self-contained storygame inspired by Greek myth, for solo or group play. Using prompts on maze tiles, you’ll tell the story of a protagonist worthy of myth as they make choices and handle consequences. You won’t explore just one series of events from beginning to end, though: you’ll traverse many branches, returning to earlier decisions to make new choices and see how events play out from there. Labyrinthine supports one to four players, with a game length of one to three hours.

52 maze tiles with unique prompts, falling into 6 types based on layout: Crosses, Branches, Halls, Turns, Ends, and Shrines
Alternate method of play using a deck of playing cards, using the keyed prompts
Card-based oracle for quickly generating protagonists (also available in handy digital form)
Overview of the classical myth of the Labyrinth, Minotaur, Theseus, and Ariadne (and exploration of the myth’s conflicting accounts)

boardgame.name: Forking Paths (Issue #3)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The theme for issue three: Out from the Shadows! The game spread throughout the zine is New Forms, an eerie atmospheric chamber larp in the Nordic style, heavily inspired by the works of horror/weird fiction/philosophy writer Thomas Ligotti. Players assemble in a strange variation of a support group, using an apparatus of light and shadow to search for unusual "forms" hidden within mundane objects, recording and discussing their findings and what insights they reveal in relation to the group's ominous otherworldly beliefs.

New Forms is playable in two hours or less and is ideal for groups of 3 to 12 players (number of players is the main factor governing the larp's runtime).

Contents of this 24-page zine:

Tone-setting short fiction piece "Ruins midnight Sunday all welcome"
12-page "in-character" pamphlet, covering the core larp activity (& doubling as an optional in-game prop if printed separately)
Observation sheet for use during the Exhibition section of the larp (physically cut & pasted together using text from a typewriter, for that bureaucratic feel!)
4 illustrated examples of recorded observations from investigated relics
Additional game context, larp-running logistics, ideas for altering the game, & larp safety tools

boardgame.name: Woord Bluf
Word Bluff
boardgame.description:
The creative word game.
Challenge your friends and family in this tactical word game. Grab a pen and create the longest words to earn the most points. All players have the same letters at their disposal, so play smart and beat your opponents. If you can’t form a word, you can choose to bluff. But when caught bluffing, you will receive penalty points. Be creative with the letters or bluff your way through the rounds and crown yourself as the ‘Word King’ with Word Bluff!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Monday Night Dueling
boardgame.description:
From Introduction:

Battlelogs: Monday Night Dueling brings the exciting world of Gear Dueling to the Heavy Gear D6 rules. Whether a Duel is fought for honor, fame or cold hard cash, the sight of giant robots beating the circuits out of each other always draws an audience.

Along with the most common types of Duels, Monday Night Dueling discusses Khayr ad-Din, the Badlands "city of trash" that is the center of Dueling on Terra Nova. Several Duelists and their machines are described, along with explanations of the vehicles' Perks and Flaws. Game statistics for new melee weapons to equip other Gears, and a copy of the Expanded Skill List for Heavy Gear D6, are also included.

boardgame.name: Terranovan Armor and Artillery
boardgame.description:
From Introduction:

Battlelogs: Terranovan Armor and Artillery is a
supplement for Heavy Gear D6, detailing combat and
combat support vehicles used by both the Northern and
Southern forces on Terra Nova. New entries for Auxiliary
Systems and Features (both positive and negative) are
also included to expand the vehicle options available in
Heavy Gear D6.

boardgame.name: Character Templates Set 1
boardgame.description:
From Introduction:

Battlelogs: Character Templates Set 1 is a collection of sample characters for Heavy Gear D6. These characters can be as instant non-player characters which can be dropped into a campaign at any time, or as examples for player characters.

These templates are built on 12 attribute dice, like other D6 NPCs. Add 6 attribute dice if using these for a player character, with a maximum of 4D for each attribute.

boardgame.name: Tower Of Pancakes!!
タワー・オブ・パンケークス‼
boardgame.description:
Tower Of Pancakes!! (タワー・オブ・パンケークス‼) is a trick-taking card game from Japan.

Cute cats love pancakes! Bake pancakes well, serve them, and aim to become the best-selling pancake maker!

There are 4 cats (A to D) waiting to be served pancakes. If they get more than 8 pancakes in a stack, the surplus becomes negative points. Except cat D, who is a glutton, and just makes more stacks of pancakes.

The players have chips of batter which are turned into cooked pancakes. The game follows standard trick-taking rules. The 1st & 2nd winners of the trick supply pancakes to the cats. The loser of the trick cooks their batter into pancakes according to the card they played.

When the tricks are played out, a final score is calculated based upon where players placed their cooked pancakes, minus penalties for over-supply.

The game has two variants in the rules; one for a different style of hand management, and one for an extreme supply of pancakes.
user summary

boardgame.name: Max geheugentrainer
boardgame.description:
PLAY THE FAMOUS SHOPPING GAME NOW AS A CARD GAME AND TEST YOUR MEMORY!
Which player remembers best what is on his shopping list? Use your memory and fill your shopping cart with the products you saw on your list at the start of the game. But beware: the other players put things in your cart that you don't need at all! Who knows to remember their shopping list until the end and comes home with the right products?

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Dice Hospital: Specialist Promo Bundle
boardgame.description:
4 Specialist cards for Dice Hospital, Previously available via the 2018-Kickstarter campaign and now for sale on the website of Alley Cat Games.

It contains:

2 x Consultant (cards feature different character art) At the beginning of each Hospital Activation Phase, chose another Specialist in your hospital. The Consultant has the same special ability as the chose Specialist until the end of the phase.
2 x Admissions Nurse (cards feature different character art): Each time this Specialist discharges a patient, you may either return an other patient to the bag, or draw a new patient from the bag to roll and add to your wards (re-roll 1's and 6's as normal).

listing.notes:
NEW
Please check out my other items and bundle and save on shipping!
Thank you,
Sebastian

boardgame.name: O Petiz Que Mordeu O Cão
boardgame.description:
This expansion was designed for children. In O Petiz Que Mordeu O Cão, children play it by telling funny stories.
This expansion can be played by adding new cards (with new words) to the base game. It is a family game, which people asks questions like "Where?", "Who?", "What?", "To Who?", "With What?".
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: O Homem Que Mordeu o Cão

listing.notes: weight: 495 grams + packaging

boardgame.name: Atelier daVinci
boardgame.description:
This game has been published by dV Giochi as a reward for winning the 2019/2020 edition of the Gioco Inedito – Best Unpublished game contest. Powered by Lucca comics & Games and dV Giochi, the contest aims to identify the best new card game design from all prototypes received and to reward it by publishing the game in a fully professional and high-quality format, overseen directly by dV Giochi. All prototypes submitted must conform to the technical and style requirements, fixed components and a given theme which changes every year. Everybody can join the contest and this is a great opportunity for emerging game designers to see their idea published.

In Maestro Leonardo's workshop, there are many apprentices who try to earn the master’s esteem. You too can participate in the creation of the greatest works of this genius of the Renaissance, painting or completing paintings shared with the group, becoming an expert in colors, and attracting the attention of the master with your achievements. Who will eventually become his pupil?

1. Take color cards from the table.
2. Use them to paint paintings and score points.
3. Score bonus points with Masteries and Achievement cards!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: 愛のてんびん (Aino tenbin)
boardgame.description:
愛のてんびん (Aino tenbin) (Love balance) is a party game from Japan.

The deck has a variety of confessions of love, such as gifts, flowers, chocolates, a ring and so on. Players try to shed their hand down to zero first, by playing a card to match another player's.

The lead player offers a card, such as a ring, to another player. If they have the same card in hand, they discard it too. If they do not have the matching card, they say they acknowledge the feelings but cannot reciprocate, so they accept the gift card into their hand. The giver is now heart-broken and draws another card from the deck as solace.

Players can block a romance by playing other cards from their hand, such as "I'm sorry", or "wait a minute!" to steal a gift, or "I'm watching you" to block a confessor.

The first player to empty their hand wins.
user summary

boardgame.name: Munchkin Enhancers
boardgame.description:
Flavor up your Munchkin games with Munchkin Enhancers, which includes thirty new monster, Treasure, Class, and Race enhancers for use with Munchkin, Munchkins & Mazes, Munchkin Tails, Munchkin Oz, or any set that uses the original Munchkin card backs.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: We're In
boardgame.description:
The firewall is down, but they know you got in. Now, it's a race to grab the most valuable information as the network shuts down around you. But be wary of the other hackers, as it's just as easy to steal from each other as from the system.

We’re In is a small route-planning game for 2 to 4 players. Each player controls an avatar moving around an ever-shrinking grid of tiles representing a nodes on company’s network, such as email servers or security cameras. When you move onto a tile, you hack the node to extract a token of information secretly worth 1, 2 or 3 points. Once all of the company’s secrets have been looted, you steal from each other instead.

With each move, tiles are tagged for suspicious activity and eventually shutdown, leaving gaps in the network and limiting your movement. When you move onto an occupied node, you are forced to share information with those players, surrendering your hard-won tokens. Your spoils are only secure after you logout of the system, either by running out of possible moves or waiting until the network gets small enough to slip out. Once everyone has logged out, the winner is the player with the most valuable set of tokens.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: DirtSlingers
boardgame.description:
DirtSlingers is a dirt-track, Sprint Car themed racing game for 2 to 8 players. Using 3 different card decks to move pawns around the oval track, many movements will not only move your pawns but other player's pawns as well.

Complete with 4 different modes of play, DirtSlingers has something for any racing fan. Play as 305 or 410 Sprint Cars and use either Rookie or Veteran gameplay. A small change in the decks of cards can make all the difference.

Like any other racing game, the goal is to get across the finish first, but the game doesn't stop there. Not only are there four different races to finish, but play multiple times and record your progresses to compete in a Season game.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Deadletterz
boardgame.description:
Spell like you and your friend's lives depended on it! Action verbs can hurt or escape the zombie, can help your friends... or not! Pick up a shotgun and spell "shoot" to blow the zombie's head off! Strengthen your spelling skills while exercising strategic thinking in this cooperative and competitive game of survival. Can you make it out alive?

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Death Ride Normandy: Sword Beach
boardgame.description:
This game focuses on the British landing at Sword Beach by the British 3rd Infantry Division.

The British 3rd Infantry Division, along with Royal Marine and Commando's, assault the continent at Sword Beach. One of the most important beaches in the entire operation due to its location nearest to the city of Caen. The city was an important objective to capture in the first day of the invasion. Some parts of the plan went perfect, such as the 1st Special Services Brigade getting to the Pegasus Bridge area to relieve the paratroopers at about 1200 hours. The picture on this box cover is of the Bagpiper that accompanied Lord Lovat, commander of 1st SS Brigade.

Death Ride Normandy - Sword Beach:
Sword Beach and Caen Maps
20+ Counter Sheets
5x Scenarios Based on each day, and a smaller Scenario each for 7-10 June
3ID Order of Battle
I Corps Order of Battle
21PzD Order of Battle
Sword WNs
Transport Charts
Wave Charts
Supplemental Rules

boardgame.name: Dogonauts: Starflea Territories
boardgame.description:
The stop-motion short film Dogonauts: Enemy Line introduces the Dogonauts universe. The card game Dogonauts: Starflea Territories continues from the film and pits players against one another to see who can repair their space ship first. Area control is the name of this game! Two versions of Dober the space dog and Fester the space flea can be chosen to deploy your battlefield tactics.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: EcoGoGo!: Grand Canyon Nat'l Park
boardgame.description:
EcoGoGo! is an educational and entertaining card game designed to inform and inspire interest in our world’s ecology. It highlights the roles of food chains, feeding, mating, and migration in the lives of organisms in a wide variety of ecosystems.

The Grand Canyon National Park deck is built on extensively researched food chains comprising real organisms found in their native habitats. Includes the Great Horned Owl, Common Kingsnake, Grand Canyon Rattlesnake, Golden-mantled Ground Squirrel, Common Earless Lizard, Darkling Beetle, and Poop. The environmental threat is Toxic Waste.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: CBI ATC: China-Burma-India Air Transport Command
boardgame.description:
This is a VERY playable (free to print off and play) aerial transportation solitaire game about the U.S. Army Air Force's effort to fly supplies to China to keep it in World War 2 and tie up so many Imperial Japanese Army soldiers on the Asian mainland which it did. http://www.CoatneyHistory.com/CBIATC.htm

(In the "Advanced" game, one player can be the Equipment transporter and the other the Fuel Transporter and separate record/chits could be kept to see if they achieve their respective delivery requirements. Of course, if either fails too often, they both lose overall, so .... :-) )

The player chooses either the H (High Himalayas) route with its hazards or the M (Japanese fighter-interceptor aerodrome at Myitkina) route. He takes the maximum number of transport aircraft pieces possible and then adds to that upside-down piece mix a number of hazard pieces equal to half the number of transports rounded up.

(In 1942-43, trying to fly the lower route over Myitkina is very much pushing your luck, depending on Japanese fighter strength and who wins the air battle.)

From that inverted total he pulls a number of pieces equal to the number of original transports and finds out if sufficient loads - DC3s/C-47s carry 1, C-46s and (B-24 Liberator transport) C-87s carry 2 (although the C-87s can only carry 1 over the High route), and the late war DC-4s/C-54s carry *4*! - make it over the Hump.

Of course, the number of loads required each season increases with the Allied supreme commanders' demands.

The USAAF Air Transport Command actually delivered far more supplies in the air than could be delivered by gas-guzzling trucks on the Burma and then Ledo/Stilwell Roads.

Hazards include Engine Failure, Unexpected Mountain, Mule Stampede! (wrecking the center of gravity ... 3,000 mules were delivered, 4 to a plane), Spontaneous Explosion (C-46s only), Bad Compass-Thick Clouds-Out of Gas, Oxygen Loss-Disorientation, and Rock Throwing Yetis! (Some planes just disappeared along the costly "Aluminum Highway." Wrecks and remains are still being found.)

The no-dice Basic Game plays in about 40 minutes max. and really gives you the overall sense of the air transport campaign. (Ernest K. Gann was an ATC pilot and later wrote the book Fate is the Hunter. The movie is free to watch on YouTube.)

The Advanced Game, differentiating Fuel and Equipment loads, including sea and rail transport cargo capacities to the East India airfields, and having abstracted ground combat rules takes longer.

All aircraft icons are by me, pixel by pixel (hence, the small datafile size of the counter sheet).

The Dedication includes mention of one Bob Coatney, who was a master sergeant based at ATC headquarters in Dacca, East India.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Employee of the Month Role Playing Game
boardgame.description:
If you’ve ever worked a day in your life, this game is for you. If you’ve ever worked a dead end job, part-time job, or stared at a clock wishing your shift or life was over and not caring which, this game is doubly for you.

Employee of the Month is a single-session role playing game wherein players work such jobs, doing mundane tasks and dealing with difficult customers until they are suddenly hurled into a possibly dangerous and most likely hilarious situation. It might be an alien invasion, the apocalypse starting in your parking lot, or worse! Together with the General Manager (GM), players will create and play out a narrative, working together to solve or survive their story with whatever skills they possess, resources available to them at their workplace, and assumptions they hold about one another.
boardgame.rpg: Employee of the Month Role Playing Game

boardgame.name: Gem Runner: Starring Bit Boy
boardgame.description:
Retro 8-bit video game-like adventure with Bit Boy battling enemies, bosses, and classic video game hazards to earn and steal Gems! The fight for justice to rid the world of evil begins with you and your friends! Join our hero. Conquer the hazards. Defeat the enemies. Obliterate the bosses. Get the Gems!

Take turns presenting each other with classic video game challenges, always putting a Gem as a reward at the end. Play with or against your friends, or even the 'computer!' Learn the depth of the subtle strategies in Gem Runner, and emerge victorious!

Presenting a challenge involves chaining elements together and trying to make the most difficult obstacles to overcome. Playing against a challenge involves matching an element or a game mechanic (e.g. punch, jump, etc.) with what is required for each challenge.

There are 4 heroes, each with their own deck (sold separately) that include all unique hazards, enemies, and bosses. Decks can be played together to expand the number of gems collectable per player, and add some unique gameplay.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.description:

The fight for justice to rid the world of evil begins with you and your friends! Join our hero. Conquer the hazards. Defeat the enemies. Obliterate the bosses. Get the Gems!

boardgame.description:
Retro 8-bit video game-like adventure with Giga Girl battling enemies, bosses, and classic video game hazards to earn and steal Gems! The fight for justice to rid the world of evil begins with you and your friends! Join our hero. Conquer the hazards. Defeat the enemies. Obliterate the bosses. Get the Gems!

Take turns presenting each other with classic video game challenges, always putting a Gem as a reward at the end. Play with or against your friends, or even the 'computer!' Learn the depth of the subtle strategies in Gem Runner, and emerge victorious!

boardgame.name: Itty Kitty
boardgame.description:
Introducing Nooki, the Itty Kitty with a penchant for adorable, feline mischief. Use memory and matching to satisfy Itty-Kitty and your desire for laughter and facepalms. Challenge your memory and a bit of strategy to prevail. No kitties (Itty or otherwise) were harmed in the making of this game.

Each turn consists of uncovering 2 face-down cards and either matching them to each other, or matching 1 or more cards from your hand. Matching connects a kitty card (which depicts Nooki desiring something) with a desire card (which depicts a desire). The player with the most cards in their kitty "bed" wins!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: My Secret Garden: Game & Puzzle
boardgame.description:
Cooperate to create a secret garden together, or compete to earn the most points in this double-sided adventure that includes a game and a puzzle. This experience is designed to be relaxing while you enjoy the simple act of putting puzzle pieces together, or lining up elements of a garden for more points. Play cooperatively or competitively with friends and family as peaceful calm surrounds you.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Peas, Pirates, and a Potato Bug
boardgame.description:
Based on the adorable children's book of rhyming tales of the same name, our Peas, Pirates, and a Potato Bug card game (nicknamed "P3") allows kids and parents to construct pictures from the book like jigsaw puzzle pieces. This is a quick and easy game for children and families to play together in a fun, relaxed environment.

P3 can be played cooperatively or competitively. Competing requires each player to finish one of the many pictures that can be constructed to collect the picture's cards. The player with the most cards at the end wins!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Polar Rails
boardgame.description:
Polar Rails is a Christmas-themed game that uses the gameplay from Empire Builder with players creating rail networks that are centered on the North Pole.

Use your initial investment to build track, then pick up commodities where they are grown, mined, or manufactured and deliver them to a lucrative place of demand. Complete a delivery and make the money you need to buy larger, faster trains and expand your railroad empire. Win the game by building the most effective railroad empire!

In more detail, players use washable crayons to draw their train routes over a map of the North Pole, including North America, Greenland, Asia, and Europe. Players start with an initial sum of money which they use to build short lengths of track during their first couple of turns. For the rest of the game, players operate their trains over the track network drawn on the board to pick up and deliver loads to various cities, then have the opportunity to add to their track network or improve their train. The game uses demand cards which list three demands, each of a commodity to be delivered to a specified city for a given payoff. Each player has three demand cards to provide opportunities for income.

Each turn consists of an operations phase and a building phase. During the operations phase, trains are moved to cities where commodities are picked up at no cost and moved to one of the cities on that player's demand cards. When the commodity is delivered, the player receives the payoff and trades that demand card for a new one. Event cards are mixed in the deck with the demand cards. When an event card is drawn the instructions are followed. During the building phase, a player may pay to build more track or upgrade their train.

A player wins by being the first to connect their track network to six of the seven major cities on the board and acquire $250,000,000 in cash on hand.

boardgame.name: Racket Roll: Tennis
boardgame.description:
Become a tennis champion by being the first to empty your deck through card-matching and rolling dice! Set in the late 70s and early 80s, up to 4 competitors engage one another to win. Includes archrivals Bjorn vs. John and Chris vs. Martina. Each is a master of a court type - grass, clay, indoor, and synthetic. Play any combination and serve yourself a winning cup with this ace!

On your turn, you either match a card with your hand with a card on the board (domino style), or roll your colored die and then place it in an empty square. The next player can match to your die, or any other die or dots printed on the minicards. The first player to place the last card of their hand wins!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Template: Possession
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Possessed characters typically have another being dwelling within their skin. In many comic books and works of horror fiction, the possessing entity is an otherworldly creature – typically a Demon, though Angels, Ghosts and a variety of other creatures exist as well. Such a creature usually has its own personality and agenda, as well as often owning a separate physical form that it may “impose” on the body of its host. This PDF contains everything you need to add this new template inspired from DC Comics Deadman or Etrigan and Marvel Comics Brother Voodoo to your Superhero genre game store and local home Super-Powered by M&M games.

boardgame.name: Sport Jockeys: American Football
boardgame.description:
Play the visceral, moment-to-moment game of American Football as a card game! Captures the essence of what it’s like to play Gridiron, without statistics, players, etc. You are the team and make the calls every play as you battle it out with the opposing team. Choose to be the home team or the visitor and it’s game on! Includes 56 cards depicting offensive and defensive actions (Run, Pass, Kick, Fake, Dive, Hail Mary, Hand-Off, Kickoff, Tackle, Fumble, etc.), 1 Offense card, 2 Score cards, 1 Reference card, and 3 Indicator cubes.

After the kickoff, the player assuming the role of offense will place a "Snap" card. The opponent can then place a card that counters or follows the snap card, such as "Tackle." Offense can counter with a "Pass." Cards can be played as combinations to increase your side's points. The goal is to get more points than your opponent every play to advance your marker on the score card. After 4 plays, offense will either score points (simulating a field goal all the way to a touchdown with a 2-point conversion) or defense will score 2 points for a safety. Play continues with the opponent assuming the role of offense.

All of this can be interrupted or changed if an opponent intercepts the ball, recovers a fumble, etc. And every action played has counters. Winning players have a little luck but play their cards strategically to maximize when to play combos, which cards to play vs. keep, and how to predict their opponent's plays. To add further depth, each card has an Offense and a Defense side to it, providing for many more play possibilities.

The deck represents either a full game, a half, or a quarter of a game. Once a full game is complete, whoever has the most points wins.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Feast of Feather
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The small hamlet of Shadn Valley has quieted down since their recent annual Pumpkin Harvest Festival. After the horrific return of the Bone Lord during those events, everyone in town is looking forward to a simple and peaceful Feast of Feather. While the Pumpkin Festival is a time to celebrate the harvest with games, parties, tournaments, and more, the Feast of Feather is when the village quietly gives thanks for the food they were able to harvest that year. They mark this with delicious feasts. Unlike the festival, however, individuals and families each have their own private feast in their homes. It is believed that their individual meals along with their humble songs of thanks will raise up to the Gods and grant them another abundant year as well as a safe and mild winter. The locals say is that the great Winter Raven whom controls the weather as it transitions from fall into cold months. They often decorate with feathers and leaves and other items you often see caught up in the late autumn wind as a tribute to this God. The hope is, if they appease the Winter Raven, the coming snows and cold will be mild and bearable.

Feast of Feather is an adventure module for the Micro Chapbook Roleplaying game system set in the mountain village of Shadn Valley in the region of Hellick Water. It is the third volume in the Bone Lord Chronicles story arc. Thus, this adventure may be played on its own or as a part of the larger campaign series of books.

boardgame.name: Catan: First Adventure
boardgame.description:
The kids on Catan are adventurous, learning to sail at a young age and wanting to spend their time sailing around the small offshore islands and playing exciting games. Today, you are playing pirates and want to build camps and a fort faster than anyone else.

In Catan: First Adventure, you start with a pirate camp that sits across two of the islands in the larger ring of islands. Each island depicts a resource, and you start with one of each of the resources showing on the islands under your camp.

On a turn, you first roll the six-sided die. On a result of 1-5, all players take a resource from the reserve if they have a camp on an island with a matching number; on a result of 6, you move the Ghost Captain to an island of your choice, taking two of the resource depicted there. No one else can claim resources from this island as long as the Ghost Captain remains there.

You then move the single ship on its course clockwise around the island. If you have one of each resource — molasses, wood, goat, cutlass — you can build a camp on an empty space adjacent to the ship. If you don't have what you need, you can trade any two resources for one of your choice, or you can spend a wood and a goat for random help from Coco the parrot. You don't know what Coco might give you, but ideally it's better than the wood and goat you just sacrificed to him!

After you build all your camps, you can build a fort on an empty space by spending two of each resource, and whoever does so first wins.
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Series: Free PnP during 2019-2020 COVID-19 Pandemic (Asmodee)

boardgame.name: Alone Against the Tide (2nd Edition)
boardgame.description:
From the back cover:

Solitaire Adventure by the Lakeshore

Set in the 1920s, Alone Against the Tide is a solo horror adventure for the Call of Cthulhu roleplaying game. You take on the role of an investigator traveling to the affluent, scenic, and remote lakeside town of Esbury, Massachusetts. You decide your pathway through the story by choosing from the options presented. Your choices not only affect what happens to your investigator, but also the fate of Esbury’s residents and visitors—even the town itself!

You may choose to create your own investigator or use the ready-to-play investigator, Dr. E. Woods, a professor of archaeology from Miskatonic University. There are a variety of reasons for visiting Esbury, but almost all are tied in some way to Esbury resident, Professor William Harris.

What has Professor Harris’ research got to do with the strange green fog enveloping the town? Who are the menacing, dark-suited men that arrived on the ferry with your investigator? And, why is a Buddhist monk visiting Esbury, a town more used to entertaining New England’s wealthy elite?

Armed with a pencil, some roleplaying dice, and a copy of the Call of Cthulhu: Keeper Rulebook or the Call of Cthulhu Starter Set, you are ready to brave the mist-shrouded streets of Esbury.

Dare you take on the challenge?

boardgame.name: Voi, Bravi ed Infelici: Tolentino 1815
boardgame.description:
"Voi, Bravi ed Infelici: Tolentino 1815" is a wargame about the Napoleonic battle of Tolentino in 1815, the decisive episode of the Austro-Neapolitan war fought by the King of Naples, Gioacchino Murat, against the Austrians led by General Federico Bianchi. This battle saw the definitive Austrian victory, with the consequent return of the Bourbons to the Neapolitan throne and is considered by some historians as the first battle of the Italian Risorgimento.

Published in italian board-wargaming magazine "ParaBellum", issue VIII.

boardgame.name: Escape the Dark Sector: The Collector's Box
boardgame.description:
An expansion in its own right, the Collector’s Box contains a wealth of new game content for Escape the Dark Sector while also providing stylish and practical storage for your entire collection.

With it’s sturdy, matte black box and minimal spot UV detailing, the imposing exterior of the Collector’s Box hides an elegant organizer within. Now you can store every item in your Escape the Dark Sector collection in one box with ease.

The custom insert features slots to perfectly divide your cards by type, sleeved or unsleeved. Not only is this immensely satisfying, it also cuts down on card handling time during setup - just slide out the desired group of cards when called for (Act 1, Act 2, Act 3, Crew Members, Bosses etc) and your game can be set up and packed away in moments.

The larger cavities are moulded to securely hold all your playmats, rulebooks, scorepads, pencils, dice etc - and as you can see the full set of 4 crew playmats combine to create a pleasing image of the station.

Contains:


4 New Bosses: An array of powerful new foes, each unique and devious
3 New Start Cards: Each offering a choice about how to begin your mission
1 Mech Suit: A powerful, full-body contraption comprising 4 slot's worth of interlocking item cards. This awesome rig grants the wearer immense armour and firepower for a limited time, and at the expense of mobility and tactical flexibility
2 New Starting Weapons: Alien sidearms with variable-ammo functionality
4 Ammo Dice: To ensure you have enough on hand for the full arsenal the game offers
4 Health Trackers with Cubes: A reusable alternative to the medical record pads
1 Dice Bag: Store all the game’s beautiful dice and tokens in one satisfying pouch
1 “Acting Captain” Card: Used to help keep track of who is leading the crew into each chapter

boardgame.name: Tag City: Graffiti Token Promo Tile
boardgame.description: A promo graffiti token. Just add it to the other graffiti tokens. You can choose it when you set up the game.

boardgame.name: Pokémon Tabletop Adventures 3 Player's Handbook 2
boardgame.description:
From the back cover:

The Player's Handbook 2 contains additional options to build your character to play Pokémon Tabletop Adventures 3, including rules to play as a Pokémon! You'll build your characters to explore and adventure in the Pokémon world!

boardgame.name: Pokémon Tabletop Adventures 3 Game Master's Guide
boardgame.description:
From the back cover:

The Game Master's Guide contains rules for running a game of Pokémon Tabletop Adventures 3. This guide is used by Game Masters and has loads of suggestions for material to use, build on top of, or use as inspiration.

Within, you'll also find the Legendary Pokédex.

boardgame.name: Cowboy Bebop: Space Serenade – Ein and Le Blob Promo Cards
boardgame.description:
These two cards were initially distributed when the French edition of the game came out.

Ein (action card): Cannot be removed from the Purchasing Area. Effect : Draw a card. Ein activates all Team Effects.

The Blob (criminal card): The active player's turn ends. Players return to Bebop and take 2 damages. As long as this card is in play, players cannot purchase cards nor move. Each player takes a turn. The player with the most Strength and Clues accumulated makes the capture. In case of a tie, all players take 1 damage and start over.

listing.notes: This is for the Ein promo card only. Payment via Venmo. Shipping free.

boardgame.name: Pokémon the Role Playing Game (2nd Ed)
Pokérole
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

We have struggled to bring you the best game we could create. Between contained emotions, inspiring words, silent prayers, loss, friends, and a community hoping to walk through the paths of their childhood memories. We wish you enjoy this game as much as we enjoyed creating it.

We began working on 2.0 in 2018 when we got together to plan a new adventure, as usual, we were discussing how we would create our Characters and from that gathering, we began working on what would become this Pokérole edition.

Since then, a lot has happened, some of us moved to another city, some of us had to pause for personal reasons, even so, we slowly and steadily kept working towards this goal.

We got here by adhering to one simple rule: your memories are not something to play with, if you saw something you liked on the games or the anime, we want you to be able to do it in the game. That’s a promise, we will make it work, even if we miss the shot a few times.

Thank you for your patience and your continuos support.

Pokérole Team wants to give you everything you need to run your games and play the Character You Want, even from the beginning. Trainers may grow even without having to raise their power. Never forget that. Try new Pokémon, Test your creativity, Challenge what you know about your Pokémon, and never be disheartened for losing.

All the best

- Pokérole Project Team

boardgame.name: The Wolfenmoot Web
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The Wolfenmoot Web is an adventure for Blue Rose Romantic Fantasy Roleplaying. In it, the heroes travel into the twilight depths of the majestic forest of the Pavin Weald to take part in the Wolfenmoot, a cultural holiday of the Forest Folk and their rhy-wolf companions. The magic of the Wolfenmoot is endangered, however, by the machinations of a spider darkfiend intent on capturing the power of the great Wolf Spirit in its web and wielding that power against the peoples of Aldis. The heroes must learn of the danger, overcome the darkfiend, and aid the rhy-wolves in saving the festival and maintaining their ties of friendship with the Forest Folk.

The Wolfenmoot Web is designed for a group of 4 to 6 Blue Rose heroes of around 5th level.

boardgame.name: Beyond the Wire
boardgame.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still in active development and available to the public for purchase in it's unfinished state, either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between).





User Summary

A large scale first person shooter set in the Western Front of World War I, Beyond the Wire pits players against each other in 50 vs 50 combat. Maps in the game span large, open ares as well as close quarters combat in trenches. The game puts an emphasis on period appropriate weapons, centered on a methodical and tactical approach with bolt-action rifle combat. It also boasts a unique melee combat system that includes directional impact and several weapon choices, allowing players to experience the brutal hand to hand combat from the Great War.

Beyond the Wire also actively encourages teamwork and strategy in order to succeed. The built-in voice chat system allows players to communicate with their fellow soldiers and develop plans as a group and as small squads. Maps are designed with strategic challenges in mind where players must find a way to cross wide open areas under enemy fire, sweep close-quarters trenches and small towns, or take the fight to the enemy in dense forest.

The game captures the brutality of war as well, creating a dark, muddy, and dreary atmosphere while also accurately portraying the horrors of World War I, complete with a realistic portrayal of injuries with gore, blood, and brutal violence. Players can also have their vision limited by attacks with chlorine gas or white phosphorus, adding yet another element they must work together to overcome.

The game is focused on historical accuracy with its setting and weapons systems, only making changes when it creates a more engaging experience for players.

boardgame.name: Kikokugai - The Cyber Slayer
boardgame.description:
Kikokugai: The Cyber Slayer (鬼哭街 -The Cyber Slayer-) is a Japanese cyberpunk visual novel by Nitroplus. It's Nitroplus' third game, and the script is written by Gen Urobuchi.

The game was remade in 2011 with enhanced graphics, a new theme song, and character voices added.

The 2011 version is also rated for ages 15 and up instead of the original game's 18+ rating

"1920" is a two-player, intermediate complexity, strategic-level wargame simulation of the "Polish-Soviet War" the Soviet attempt to conquer Poland. Soviet and Polish forces engulf each other in swift campaigns, fighting on a large area stretching from Kiev and Smolensk in the East to Warsaw and Thorn in the West. Will the Red Army prevail and bring happiness and peace to the German and French working classes or will the Poles pull off a magnificent victory one can only describe as a 'miracle'? It only needs two players to find out an answer to this question in this exciting 2 hour wargame.

Players can learn the game via four short scenarios, being gradually introduced to the game mechanics and quickly able to grasp the accurate concept of lines of control, surprising rail transfers, and morale advantages and understand the strategic ramifications of the theater of war. Further rules cover army morale advantages, revolutionary mobilization organized by the hated Soviet political police the Cheka, the torn loyalties of the Ukrainians, fighting on both sides of the front and the formation of the Polish Volunteer Army.

A plethora of formations and units appear in the game: the Latvian Rifles, the dreaded Budyenny's Horse Army, counter-revolutionary Russian, Belorussian and Cossack troops, various Polish formations including the Siberian Brigade, support units such as tanks, flotillas, armored cars and above all armored trains, which were extensively used in the campaign.

boardgame.name: Successors (Fourth Edition)
Successors: Las Guerras de los Diádocos
Sukcesorzy
boardgame.description:
When Alexander the Great died in 323 BC, he left no clear heir to the immense empire he had conquered. It was not long after his death that the Macedonian generals began to war among themselves over who would be the regent or successor to Alexander's empire.
By 305 BC they had given up on succession and began to carve out their own kingdoms.

Successors is a 2-5 player card-driven wargame based on those wars.

Successors was first published in 1997 by Avalon Hill.
Some years later a second edition rulebook was published that gave more options for the Tyche cards.
Then Successors III, built on the foundation of the Successors II rules set plus expansion cards, appeared in the Boardgamer.

The fourth edition of Successors includes more generals, more scenarios, new Tyche cards, plenty of new components, and a changed map, with Libya and Cyrene being merged.

boardgame.name: Risky Chicken
boardgame.description:
In Risky Chicken, each player is a chicken who wants to get rich. The winning player is the first to obtain a certain number of Gold Coins.

Players take turns being the Leader of climbs up the Golden Mountain, each turn choosing a Sidekick to join them on this journey. As players ascend the Golden Mountain, they land on levels with increasing amounts of Gold Coins, but they also grow likelier to “fall off” the mountain.

At every level, the Leader and Sidekick must each decide whether to Climb (continue to press their luck) or Chicken Out (cash out and end the turn.) Both players often agree that Chickening Out is a wise decision, and they may agree to play their Chicken Out cards. However, each player can benefit by breaking their promise and playing Climb, at the expense of the other. This dynamic is inspired by the “Repeated Prisoner’s Dilemma” model of game theory. Players must weigh their greed in the short term against the value of their alliances.

Each player also receives one Chicken Trick card which gives them a special rule-bending ability (variable player power). There are 12 Chicken Trick cards, each representing a unique, silly chicken character.

-description from the publisher

"There must be an item here!" Players will surely say that when they barely crawl out there. Sure, there is, breastplate, heavy one - party maximum is medium armor. We know you will make use of this two story, siege-ready and cannon-loaded fort! (Maybe their first real-estate?)

boardgame.name: Aegis Fort
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

I have never seen Grizkh so excited. He stopped examining tracks and paced through the fine sand of Aegis Desert. He wanted to repay me for kindness I've shown him, not realizing that I needed him more than the other way around. He was proud of being raised by monks in the desert temple – feeling more significant than he thought of himself.

Eastern sun blinded us when as we approached tall temple walls. My eyes adjusted as I allowed myself to perceive – this was no monk temple at all.

My eyes met the panic of Grizkh's.

Dozen brush helmets pointed shiny crossbows at us. Commander in white armor took off his helmet and bellowed:

"In the name of Heliod, stop where you are!"

boardgame.name: Ancient Tomb
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Letter was scarce and with little to no information but beautifully written. She curved the letters as only she knew – her words were dancing in mesmerizing rhythm before my eyes. Small parchment was wet and ink was spilling in its cracks, but without the chance to diminish the elegance of its content.

However, the words were as sharp and uncompromising as her character. Féana was already in my debt, yet she was in trouble. Again. The Bardess was skilled and fearless. Yet she needed my help. Again.

As I mounted on my mare, I felt excitement. Not only that I'll visit the fabled Highplane, I'll see my friend again. No scar or wound can ruin the heavenly beauty of the Half Elves and their wit and charisma were out of this world, making them desirable company. And much more.

Their blood, on the other side, is desired even more. From the letter I found out that the Desert Warlocks have gotten her scent. She needs my help to lure them in the old family tomb outside the slopes of Isidor's Peak, capital of Highplane, an ancient home of all half-human people.

boardgame.name: BBEG Lair
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

In the times before my unlikely and pleasant friendship with Grizkh, I roamed the land armed only with my wit and few concoctions. I could hide as the next scrawny wizard, and I did it well.

Ruins of Oldport became my obsession. Endless tunnels under the rock and sand and dried-out river. Pillars everywhere, statues of long forgotten heroes turning to dust. Royal palace is still standing tall, housing only danger and luring me into its bowels.

I had my wit, but I was never that smart, and always brave. So it happens, I met an equally stubborn companion.

It's important to note that you have to get written permission from Sandport's ruler to even come near the ruins. Endless bureaucracy with tons of paper and greasing proper gears wasn't my way. I sneaked into it, risking death penalty on spot.

As I investigated near the palace, someone pulled my sleeve and we both lost our ground. We rolled endlessly, ending at the bottom of a huge, ornate door. I looked up, and I was stunned. She was Half-Elf. Bruised, dirty, ragged, but she was the most beautiful creature I've seen.

"A little 'Thank you' would suffice. I pulled you right before three dragonborn guards saw your stroll."

She smiled and gave me a hand.

"Féana, nice to meet you."

boardgame.name: Cave Entrance
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

"Aaron, I don't like this place."

The human side of my half-orc companion shakily spoke as we dove deeper into the frozen depths of damned Steel Mountains. The bulky barbarian somehow looked smaller and his yellow eyes childishly sought mine; I have never seen Grizkh afraid. I was, however, serene as we climbed up the small rocky plateau.

Enormous, carefully carved face stoically watched us, with darkness of its mouth inviting us in. Noticeable hole in the helmet's face was more than revealing. Silence was ominous, birds ceased to sing.

Rough, crumbling slopes framed the scenery hinting that there was only one way out of here. A way in. Live mountain was given the visage of the relic I craved for decades. Grizkh was a master tracker, yet those marks a child would track – a huge, earth pressing, stamp-like footsteps. I was aware of the ill-tempered frost giants. Yet, the helmet will be mine.

boardgame.name: Cave System
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

My eyes were still adapting to darkness; as my nose was one step ahead.

Air was imbued with strong cinnamon note. With face in the wet, yet warm soil, I couldn’t miss it. Someone was cooking and it was strangely familiar.

From the floor I was laying on, I could’ve seen dim and barely noticeable orange torchlight.

I felt as warmth started to evenly distribute throughout my body as the dimensional chill was passing away. Even though I had some experience with portal traveling, I barely remembered it was essential to be of a calm mind and focus. Crippled and incapacitated cannot pass through portal unless being carried by conscious one – as I somehow did with Grizkh. He opened his yellow eyes.

"Portal spat us out at this location for a reason. Someone once calibrated it right here. That might have been a thousand of years ago, I do not know." I tried to sound as gentle as I could.

"This cave, or what it was before, was important.

boardgame.name: Church
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Three weeks of seemingly endless journey ended at the gate of Torncastle. Once a mighty stronghold, cultural and trade capital of the South-West, now a rogue town of ghosts, cutthroats and criminals. Grizkh was joyfully feeding pigeons and birds seemed to love him.

I shrouded my face in a shawl I found in one of the dungeons and tried to lead the way – I was never in Torncastle. Grizkh followed me, but after a while, he instinctively guided us through narrow alleys, a shortcut. We found ourselves in the courtyard of a great church, its walls scribbled with childish nonsense and cultist invocations. He fixed his eyes on the entrance.

boardgame.name: Encounters
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

What do you need the most when you craft your session? We know that you tailor every tiny bit to perfection, but there is always that bard/sorcerer misfit who strays the party from the path intended!

We have made 9 unique and wonderfully generic encounter maps to accompany any campaign. Whether they're lost in the desert ruins, fighting the celestial battle in the high skies or simply camping in the mythical forest clearing, these maps will definitely come in handy in any story.

boardgame.name: Forest Hilltop
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

I never had love for hill druids, especially ones with no contact with civilized folk. Their language was fast and chaotic, their words were snarling and growling even in their human form. They ran through the forests of Baul, naked and wild.

boardgame.name: Gauntlet Island
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

"Did you find what you were looking for, my friend?"

Harsh and sturdy voice of my half-orc companion was gone. His mouth was moving, saying the words, but the silky perfection of celestial multichord melody was twirling around my mind. He was floating half-foot mid-air, a withered gauntlet swallowed his right hand and his eyes burning white. The entity that spoke through him was somehow merciful to us, perhaps after it satiated its hunger for slaughter on our party.

boardgame.name: Graveyard
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

"Legend said that the once Holy ground was tainted with dark magic, causing resilient vines to grow and stir the eternal rest of souls being buried here. Crumbling walls, scattered graves, long-gone mausoleum and seemingly intact gargoyles guarding the entrance were too much for common folk."

boardgame.name: Igloo Village
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

"Are we there yet?"

He sounded like a broken music box, childishly repeating the same question over and over again, loudly and reluctantly dragging his boots through the snow.

"I'm sure it's around this cliff, Grizkh."

"You said that last four cliffs, Aaron. Stop treating me like a child."

boardgame.name: Prison
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

"Hey, it's beautiful! Look at the sea, look at the coconut-white beaches. Look around, Aaron!"

As he was skilled in combat, he was thick as the prison wall surrounding us. I knew that he could smash through with his iron half-orc head – and swam ashore with me on top of his back; yet I enjoyed quiet and soft sound of waves caressing the said coconut-beach. I've decided to let Grizkh discover the skeleton in the cell next door and I might catch a few hours of sleep.

boardgame.name: Rock Ring
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

"Aaron, tell me the monk story again!"

For some reason, Grizkh loved the story of Bonk the Monk and his training routine. Being bulky and not-so-athletic, my half-orc friend enjoyed listening about agile creatures, especially if they're of his race.

"Again?" I smirked as I covered my face in a scarf and loomed over the fireplace, in narrator's manner. Grizkh sat on the dusty dungeon floor. We will rest shortly and, I am sure, benefit from it.

boardgame.name: Royal Tower
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Folk say shivers vanish after your body gets accustomed to it, but I have never been nor will I ever be comfortable around the Tower. I have always considered my essence to be a blessing, but around this wretched building I see myself as cursed. My eye caught Grizkh.

"No!" I said as I grabbed his wrist. "Don't smell nor pick flowers here."

boardgame.name: Tavern
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

"Ale for me. Wine for you? Am I rite, Aaron?"

I could've bitten the excitement my half-orc companion radiated. I was dying for a glass of good ol' Crlyen Red. Nothing compared to his love to ale. ANY ale. Grizkh just loved the coin-liquid ratio: for one gold, he would have drank the full basement of Stype's spoiled ale. I made sure he earned that gold.

boardgame.name: Pendant Estate
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

I love creating custom invitations for my players in my own games and handing it to them when things become (seemingly) predictable. I just invited them to one spoiled count's estate for yearly Zone of Truth Party! Dare to come? Do you really want to hear unbearable secrets? Count has loyal wizard on payroll who swears his Memory Wipe potions are uncontested! What could go wrong?

Battlemap properties:

Resolution: 2450x1750px @ 70 DPI

boardgame.name: Nemo's War (Second Edition): Journey's End Expansion
Nemo's War: Das Ende der Reise
boardgame.description:
The final expansion for Nemo's War (Second Edition), including new finale cards, a new character, additional motives and adventures, and an official 2-player variant.

A COMPREHENSIVE OPERATIONS MANUAL & BETWEEN VOYAGES GUIDE: The new Operations Manual shows how to run the ship turn-by-turn and includes many useful appendices at the end, while the new Between Voyages Guide features instruction for setup, ending the game, scoring, epilogues, variants, and more!

A NEW 2-PLAYER VERSUS VARIANT: Joining the riveting solo and cooperative modes where players command the Nautilus, in this game variant one player will play as the Imperialists, bent on its defeat. Includes special cards and 2 Imperial Squadron Miniatures!

A NEW CHARACTER TILE: Entering our story is Nemo’s son, Nadeen Dakkar, who crosses paths with his father after hearing news of mysterious events at sea!

NEW FINALE CARDS: Spice up your endings with The Trap, Imperialists’ Catspaw, Scientific Espionage, and The Kraken!

NEW STERN MOTIVES, ADDITIONAL NAUTILUS UPGRADES, AND EVEN MORE TOKENS & MARKERS!

boardgame.name: Veil 2.0.2.0. Revised
Veil 2020
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This game exists because of a question: As World of Dungeons is to Dungeon World, what would the World of Dungeons equivalent of The Veil be? Rather than playing an old(er) school, rules-light, version of Dungeons & Dragons, the “retro” version of cyberpunk in the roleplaying game space is the game line: Cyberpunk; chiefly Cyberpunk 2020. ‘Punks who rebel against megacorporations rather than delve into dungeons to find treasure. Veil 2020 is my answer.

A few stand out features of Veil 2020:


A simple roll procedure that facilitates the player contributing to the stakes and possible consequences of each roll for maximum investment



3 simple, flexible, and wide-ranging classes designed to accommodate familiar cyberpunk character archetypes and brand new concepts



A simple economy system that helps incentivize the player characters to hurt the megacoporations. Money gained for hurting the establishment counts toward character experience. Spend your time doing what matters and get rewarded for it!


From the introduction:

First published in Codex: Chrome 2, this version clarifies and adds to the original text but does not add any new mechanics or rules. The aim was simply to make things clearer. This “stripped-down” version of The Veil retains some of its DNA in setting details and mechanics, but is primarily designed to facilitate a more action-packed, mission based, cyberpunk adventure; be they adventures produced by the Cyberpunk game line, or otherwise.

boardgame.name: Fifty Forest Encounters
boardgame.description:
"Who knows what lurks in the depths of the forest? Well, here at Green Bird RPGs we have a good idea. Here are fifty random encounters designed to stimulate your imagination during game play. From pixies shouting obscenities to sunbathing, nudist elves. All based on a D100 table."

(Author Summary)

boardgame.name: Dice Party
boardgame.description:
The night is still young and the Party community starts off to find the best Party in town. For now the streets are full of people but soon the vibe will rise on the dance floors. Who is the host making the most money out of his guests? Who throws the coolest Party? And which Party will end in a brawl?

Dice Party is a dice game for 2-4 players in which every player acts as a party host, throwing a party that competes with the parties of the other players. Each player has up to 60 dice to throw, representing party guests of three types: cool Party People (yellow), high society VIPs (orange) and experience-driven rowdys, referred to as Mob (red).

While each round is a tactical challenge, since you have three different win conditions to outreach your opponents, the game unfolds its strategic depth with its Party Animal mode. Playing this full mode you're playing multiple rounds, trying to achieve complete victory by winning once with each of the 3 victory conditions:

All other Partys escalate due to their Mob guests.
A VIP millionaire hits your Party.
You pickpocket six wallets from your Party People.

boardgame.name: 花嫁が多すぎる(Too Many Brides)
boardgame.description:
Based on the Quintessential Quintuplets manga: Players vie to influence which of the quintuplets will marry Futaro Uesugi.

In each round, players are dealt 5 cards. They play one card at a time until everyone has only 2 cards left.

On your turn, you can either discard a card to change the order of the candidates, or "whisper": play a card to cause a trait to be undesirable. Immediately after a whisper, there is a simultaneous vote. Anyone who wants to challenge the whisper discards a card to do so.

At the end of the round, players score their highest-ranked candidate card that isn't cancelled by a previously unchallenged whisper.

The game ends after a set number of rounds:

3 player - 6 rounds
4 player - 4 rounds
5 player - 5 rounds.

Then the player with the most points is the winner.

boardgame.name: Family Inc.
boardgame.description:
Once a year, all family members of the notorious Azzardo family meet in the warehouse of the "Tutti Frutti" seafood restaurant to divide up the stolen goods according to an old family tradition. Everyone can try their luck, but only one will leave the meeting with a full suitcase. Who will prove to be the most skillful player in the hot-blooded game of gamblers, skillfully challenging luck and risk?

At the start of each round in Family Inc., if you have face-up chips in front of you, you score them, advancing your counter on the score board, then removing those chips from the game. Next, you reveal one new chip after another from the middle of the table, placing them face up in front of you.

After each new chip, you decide whether to reveal more chips or whether to end your turn. If you reveal a new chip during your turn that matches one of your face-up chips, your turn ends, collecting only a diamond in compensation if your turn ended after your second or third chip reveal. (If you collect a third diamond, return all your diamonds and score 50 points.) When you end your turn voluntarily, collect all face-up chips from in front of other players that match the values of your chips.

When a player reaches the 100 space on the score track, the game ends and this player wins.

boardgame.name: Micro Chapbook RPG Deluxe Core Rulebook: Updated Edition
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Micro Chapbook RPG system is an ultra simple roleplaying game that can be played solo or with a traditional GM if you so wish.

The main game focuses on solitaire gameplay, starring a single foolhardy hero. It uses randomly generated dungeon scenarios to make each game session a little different.

The universe for this game is brutal, unforgiving, and dark. It takes notes from such classics as Dungeon Quest and Deathtrap Dungeon. Expect to die and die often.

This new Updated Edition of the Core Rulebook includes all the same rules and guides as the original Deluxe Core Rulebook.

However, it ALSO includes new rules and updates to help make this version of the game more consistent with (and build upon) the newer Basic Rules Set found in the “Starter Adventure Series Games.”

In here you will find:

Starter spells for Wizards
Starter spells for Bards
Bardic Instruments
New Boss Spawn rules for shorter dungeons
Damage Bonus Rules
Health and Willpower upgrades when you level up.
Rules for Dual Wielding and Double Shot abilities
Optional Rules for “Rolling High.”
The 5 Adventure Scenarios from the Deluxe Scenario Collection 1!

EvenQuads games use symbols representing four major mathematical organizations and EvenBetter games use the flip sides featuring amazing women mathematicians.

All five games are mathematical. EvenQuads games challenge your matching speed as you collect Quads, as solitaire, with friends or in a rummy version. EvenBetter games help you learn about the featured women. All five games are specially designed to accommodate our unique double-sided cards.

Deck 1 (of 4) of EvenQuads includes 64 cards, and an insert with instructions in both English y Español, and a description of the EvenQuads mathematics.

boardgame.name: One Shots of the Reikland
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Five Rapid-Fire Adventures in the Grim and Perilous Old World

One Shots of the Reikland offers five short adventures designed for a single frenetic session of play. Each is designed to be easily slotted into an ongoing campaign or played as a standalone adventure.

One Shots of the Reikland includes:

Come Drown with Me: The business of navigating locks is tedious enough, but to find yourself leaving a lock only to arrive back where you started? Something is afoot at Hartsklein Lock — or perhaps, beneath it.
The Lock-in: A quiet night at an inn takes a sharp turn when an enthusiastic Witch Hunter and his mob barricade everyone inside and demand that the heretics be sent out, or they’ll burn the place to the ground with everyone inside. Last orders, please?
The Siege of Walen Temple: A father’s mistake returns to haunt the good folk of a sleepy Reikland village. Crowded inside the stout walls of a Temple to Sigmar, how long can they hope to hold out against the ravening horde outside?
Curd Your Enthusiasm: An evening of fine wine and vittals ends in disaster and death, and somehow it seems that the cheese might be to blame...
A Sheep in Wolf’s Clothing: An injured noble is dutifully cared for by the farmers he holds responsible — but is there a limit to hospitality?

boardgame.name: Flowers Beneath the Mountain
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Casual Stroll Through a Wondrous Locale

Flowers Beneath the Mountain is a licensed adventure for Ryuutama. Designed as an evocative introductory adventure for new players who want to explore a region that has more magic and whimsy than the standard setting, Flowers Beneath the Mountain is a simple adventure that provides useful information to help veteran or first time Ryuujin to fill out sheets on their own.

Time to Hit the Road!
Within the pages of Flowers Beneath the Mountain you'll find adorable art, the tokens needed to represent most of the creatures and characters, a wholesome romp through a floral cavern, and a selection of new monsters!

FOUR new monsters for the Draconomica
TOKENS for use on Virtual Tabletops or real tables
TWO new settlements
ONE fantastic adventure

boardgame.name: Pirates of the Dread Sea
boardgame.description:
Pirates of the Dread Sea is a fast paced, fun tabletop skirmish game for two or more players. In Pirates of the Dread Sea you create a crew of pirates from various fantasy races (or just use the pre-designed crews) such as Orcs, Dwarves, the Undead or Humans and fight for treasure and survival. Although PODS can be enjoyed as a single game, and can easily be taught to new players for an evenings entertainment, it can also support long campaigns, during which players can personalise and upgrade their crews.

Games of PODS are based on a Scenario. Scenario’s usually involve finding treasure, though sometimes they may involve capturing or rescuing hostages, or simply fighting. Each player controls a small Crew of miniatures (around half a dozen) and players take it in turns to act with one miniature at a time. During a miniatures “phase” they can perform two Actions (Captain’s can perform three) such as moving, shooting and fighting hand to hand.

In addition to a huge variety of weapons, skills and traits which can be applied to characters dependent on their race and experience, Event Cards add another level of tactics to the game. An Event Card can throw your opponent entirely off track, or boost your own forces, whether that be by ensuing the enemy miss a shot, or by boosting your crews morale by singing a shanty to them!

Pirates of the Dread Sea is a PIRATE war game, not just a war game with a pirate theme tacked on. Everything about the game has been designed to fit the setting, and create fun, narrative, exciting adventures on your tabletop.

—description from the publisher
